00099 /*
00100    Smoothes the input image with gaussian kernel and then down-samples it.
00101    dst_width = floor(src_width/2)[+1],
00102    dst_height = floor(src_height/2)[+1]
00103 */
00104 CVAPI(void)  cvPyrDown( const CvArr* src, CvArr* dst,
00105                         int filter CV_DEFAULT(CV_GAUSSIAN_5x5) );
00106 
00107 /*
00108    Up-samples image and smoothes the result with gaussian kernel.
00109    dst_width = src_width*2,
00110    dst_height = src_height*2
00111 */
00112 CVAPI(void)  cvPyrUp( const CvArr* src, CvArr* dst,
00113                       int filter CV_DEFAULT(CV_GAUSSIAN_5x5) );

00394 /* Retrieves the rectangular image region with specified center from the input array.
00395  dst(x,y) <- src(x + center.x - dst_width/2, y + center.y - dst_height/2).
00396  Values of pixels with fractional coordinates are retrieved using bilinear interpolation*/

00400 /* Retrieves quadrangle from the input array.
00401     matrixarr = ( a11  a12 | b1 )   dst(x,y) <- src(A[x y]' + b)
00402                 ( a21  a22 | b2 )   (bilinear interpolation is used to retrieve pixels
00403                                      with fractional coordinates)
00404 */
00405 CVAPI(void)  cvGetQuadrangleSubPix( const CvArr* src, CvArr* dst,
00406                                     const CvMat* map_matrix );

00445 /* Initalizes contour retrieving process.
00446    Calls cvStartFindContours.
00447    Calls cvFindNextContour until null pointer is returned
00448    or some other condition becomes true.
00449    Calls cvEndFindContours at the end. */
00450 CVAPI(CvContourScanner)  cvStartFindContours( CvArr* image, CvMemStorage* storage,
00451                             int header_size CV_DEFAULT(sizeof(CvContour)),
00452                             int mode CV_DEFAULT(CV_RETR_LIST),

00502 CVAPI(void)  cvCalcOpticalFlowHS( const CvArr* prev, const CvArr* curr,
00503                                   int use_previous, CvArr* velx, CvArr* vely,
00504                                   double lambda, CvTermCriteria criteria );

00506 #define  CV_LKFLOW_PYR_A_READY       1
00507 #define  CV_LKFLOW_PYR_B_READY       2
00508 #define  CV_LKFLOW_INITIAL_GUESSES   4
00509 #define  CV_LKFLOW_GET_MIN_EIGENVALS 8
00510 
00511 /* It is Lucas & Kanade method, modified to use pyramids.
00512    Also it does several iterations to get optical flow for
00513    every point at every pyramid level.
00514    Calculates optical flow between two images for certain set of points (i.e.
00515    it is a "sparse" optical flow, which is opposite to the previous 3 methods) */
00516 CVAPI(void)  cvCalcOpticalFlowPyrLK( const CvArr*  prev, const CvArr*  curr,
00517                                      CvArr*  prev_pyr, CvArr*  curr_pyr,
00518                                      const CvPoint2D32f* prev_features,
00519                                      CvPoint2D32f* curr_features,
00520                                      int       count,
00521                                      CvSize    win_size,
00522                                      int       level,
00523                                      char*     status,
00524                                      float*    track_error,
00525                                      CvTermCriteria criteria,
00526                                      int       flags );
00527 
00528 
00529 /* Modification of a previous sparse optical flow algorithm to calculate
00530    affine flow */
00531 CVAPI(void)  cvCalcAffineFlowPyrLK( const CvArr*  prev, const CvArr*  curr,
00532                                     CvArr*  prev_pyr, CvArr*  curr_pyr,
00533                                     const CvPoint2D32f* prev_features,
00534                                     CvPoint2D32f* curr_features,
00535                                     float* matrices, int  count,
00536                                     CvSize win_size, int  level,
00537                                     char* status, float* track_error,
00538                                     CvTermCriteria criteria, int flags );

00550 /********************************* motion templates *************************************/
00551 
00552 /****************************************************************************************\
00553 *        All the motion template functions work only with single channel images.         *
00554 *        Silhouette image must have depth IPL_DEPTH_8U or IPL_DEPTH_8S                   *
00555 *        Motion history image must have depth IPL_DEPTH_32F,                             *
00556 *        Gradient mask - IPL_DEPTH_8U or IPL_DEPTH_8S,                                   *
00557 *        Motion orientation image - IPL_DEPTH_32F                                        *
00558 *        Segmentation mask - IPL_DEPTH_32F                                               *
00559 *        All the angles are in degrees, all the times are in milliseconds                *
00560 \****************************************************************************************/
00561

00564                                       double timestamp, double duration );

00569                                      double delta1, double delta2,
00570                                      int aperture_size CV_DEFAULT(3));
00571

00576                                         const CvArr* mhi, double timestamp,
00577                                         double duration );

00582                                 CvMemStorage* storage,
00583                                 double timestamp, double seg_thresh );

00646 /************************* high-level subdivision functions ***************************/
00647 
00648 /* Simplified Delaunay diagram creation */
00649 CV_INLINE  CvSubdiv2D* cvCreateSubdivDelaunay2D( CvRect rect, CvMemStorage* storage )
00650 {
00651     CvSubdiv2D* subdiv = cvCreateSubdiv2D( CV_SEQ_KIND_SUBDIV2D, sizeof(*subdiv),
00652                          sizeof(CvSubdiv2DPoint), sizeof(CvQuadEdge2D), storage );
00653 
00654     cvInitSubdivDelaunay2D( subdiv, rect );
00655     return subdiv;
00656 }
00657 
00658

00660 CVAPI(CvSubdiv2DPoint*)  cvSubdivDelaunay2DInsert( CvSubdiv2D* subdiv, CvPoint2D32f pt);

00663    the point is left to or belongs to, or the triangulation point the given
00664    point coinsides with */

00667                                CvSubdiv2DEdge* edge,
00668                                CvSubdiv2DPoint** vertex CV_DEFAULT(NULL) );

00680 
00681 
00682 /************ Basic quad-edge navigation and operations ************/
00683 
00684 CV_INLINE  CvSubdiv2DEdge  cvSubdiv2DNextEdge( CvSubdiv2DEdge edge )
00685 {
00686     return  CV_SUBDIV2D_NEXT_EDGE(edge);
00687 }
00688 
00689 
00690 CV_INLINE  CvSubdiv2DEdge  cvSubdiv2DRotateEdge( CvSubdiv2DEdge edge, int rotate )
00691 {
00692     return  (edge & ~3) + ((edge + rotate) & 3);
00693 }
00694 
00695 CV_INLINE  CvSubdiv2DEdge  cvSubdiv2DSymEdge( CvSubdiv2DEdge edge )
00696 {
00697     return edge ^ 2;
00698 }
00699 
00700 CV_INLINE  CvSubdiv2DEdge  cvSubdiv2DGetEdge( CvSubdiv2DEdge edge, CvNextEdgeType type )
00701 {
00702     CvQuadEdge2D* e = (CvQuadEdge2D*)(edge & ~3);
00703     edge = e->next[(edge + (int)type) & 3];
00704     return  (edge & ~3) + ((edge + ((int)type >> 4)) & 3);
00705 }
00706 
00707 
00708 CV_INLINE  CvSubdiv2DPoint*  cvSubdiv2DEdgeOrg( CvSubdiv2DEdge edge )
00709 {
00710     CvQuadEdge2D* e = (CvQuadEdge2D*)(edge & ~3);
00711     return (CvSubdiv2DPoint*)e->pt[edge & 3];
00712 }
00713 
00714 
00715 CV_INLINE  CvSubdiv2DPoint*  cvSubdiv2DEdgeDst( CvSubdiv2DEdge edge )
00716 {
00717     CvQuadEdge2D* e = (CvQuadEdge2D*)(edge & ~3);
00718     return (CvSubdiv2DPoint*)e->pt[(edge + 2) & 3];
00719 }
00720 
00721 
00722 CV_INLINE  double  cvTriangleArea( CvPoint2D32f a, CvPoint2D32f b, CvPoint2D32f c )
00723 {
00724     return (b.x - a.x) * (c.y - a.y) - (b.y - a.y) * (c.x - a.x);
00725 }

00943 /* Types of thresholding */
00944 #define CV_THRESH_BINARY      0  /* value = value > threshold ? max_value : 0       */
00945 #define CV_THRESH_BINARY_INV  1  /* value = value > threshold ? 0 : max_value       */
00946 #define CV_THRESH_TRUNC       2  /* value = value > threshold ? threshold : value   */
00947 #define CV_THRESH_TOZERO      3  /* value = value > threshold ? value : 0           */
00948 #define CV_THRESH_TOZERO_INV  4  /* value = value > threshold ? 0 : value           */
00949 #define CV_THRESH_MASK        7
00950 
00951 #define CV_THRESH_OTSU        8  /* use Otsu algorithm to choose the optimal threshold value;
00952                                     combine the flag with one of the above CV_THRESH_* values */

01038 /* Finds lines on binary image using one of several methods.
01039    line_storage is either memory storage or 1 x <max number of lines> CvMat, its
01040    number of columns is changed by the function.

01042    rho, theta and threshold are used for each of those methods;

01055                               int max_radius CV_DEFAULT(0));

01089 struct CvLSH;
01090 struct CvLSHOperations;
01091 
01092 /* Construct a Locality Sensitive Hash (LSH) table, for indexing d-dimensional vectors of
01093    given type. Vectors will be hashed L times with k-dimensional p-stable (p=2) functions. */
01094 CVAPI(struct CvLSH*) cvCreateLSH(struct CvLSHOperations* ops, int d,
01095                                  int L CV_DEFAULT(10), int k CV_DEFAULT(10),
01096                                  int type CV_DEFAULT(CV_64FC1), double r CV_DEFAULT(4),
01097                                  int64 seed CV_DEFAULT(-1));
01098 
01099 /* Construct in-memory LSH table, with n bins. */
01100 CVAPI(struct CvLSH*) cvCreateMemoryLSH(int d, int n, int L CV_DEFAULT(10), int k CV_DEFAULT(10),
01101                                        int type CV_DEFAULT(CV_64FC1), double r CV_DEFAULT(4),
01102                                        int64 seed CV_DEFAULT(-1));
01103 
01104 /* Free the given LSH structure. */
01105 CVAPI(void) cvReleaseLSH(struct CvLSH** lsh);
01106 
01107 /* Return the number of vectors in the LSH. */
01108 CVAPI(unsigned int) LSHSize(struct CvLSH* lsh);
01109 
01110 /* Add vectors to the LSH structure, optionally returning indices. */
01111 CVAPI(void) cvLSHAdd(struct CvLSH* lsh, const CvMat* data, CvMat* indices CV_DEFAULT(0));
01112 
01113 /* Remove vectors from LSH, as addressed by given indices. */
01114 CVAPI(void) cvLSHRemove(struct CvLSH* lsh, const CvMat* indices);
01115 
01116 /* Query the LSH n times for at most k nearest points; data is n x d,
01117    indices and dist are n x k. At most emax stored points will be accessed. */
01118 CVAPI(void) cvLSHQuery(struct CvLSH* lsh, const CvMat* query_points,
01119                        CvMat* indices, CvMat* dist, int k, int emax);

01128     float hessian;
01129 } CvSURFPoint;
01130 
01131 CV_INLINE CvSURFPoint cvSURFPoint( CvPoint2D32f pt, int laplacian,
01132                                    int size, float dir CV_DEFAULT(0),
01133                                    float hessian CV_DEFAULT(0))
01134 {
01135     CvSURFPoint kp;
01136     kp.pt = pt;
01137     kp.laplacian = laplacian;
01138     kp.size = size;
01139     kp.dir = dir;
01140     kp.hessian = hessian;
01141     return kp;
01142 }

01161 
01162 typedef struct CvMSERParams
01163 {
01164     // delta, in the code, it compares (size_{i}-size_{i-delta})/size_{i-delta}
01165     int delta;
01166     // prune the area which bigger/smaller than max_area/min_area
01167     int maxArea;
01168     int minArea;
01169     // prune the area have simliar size to its children
01170     float maxVariation;
01171     // trace back to cut off mser with diversity < min_diversity
01172     float minDiversity;
01173     /* the next few params for MSER of color image */
01174     // for color image, the evolution steps
01175     int maxEvolution;
01176     // the area threshold to cause re-initialize
01177     double areaThreshold;
01178     // ignore too small margin
01179     double minMargin;
01180     // the aperture size for edge blur
01181     int edgeBlurSize;
01182 }
01183 CvMSERParams;
01184 
01185 CVAPI(CvMSERParams) cvMSERParams( int delta CV_DEFAULT(5), int min_area CV_DEFAULT(60),
01186                            int max_area CV_DEFAULT(14400), float max_variation CV_DEFAULT(.25f),
01187                            float min_diversity CV_DEFAULT(.2f), int max_evolution CV_DEFAULT(200),
01188                            double area_threshold CV_DEFAULT(1.01),
01189                            double min_margin CV_DEFAULT(.003),
01190                            int edge_blur_size CV_DEFAULT(5) );
01191

01533 /* stereo correspondence parameters and functions */
01534 
01535 #define CV_STEREO_BM_NORMALIZED_RESPONSE  0
01536 #define CV_STEREO_BM_XSOBEL               1
01537 
01538 /* Block matching algorithm structure */
01539 typedef struct CvStereoBMState
01540 {
01541     // pre-filtering (normalization of input images)
01542     int preFilterType; // =CV_STEREO_BM_NORMALIZED_RESPONSE now
01543     int preFilterSize; // averaging window size: ~5x5..21x21
01544     int preFilterCap; // the output of pre-filtering is clipped by [-preFilterCap,preFilterCap]
01545 
01546     // correspondence using Sum of Absolute Difference (SAD)
01547     int SADWindowSize; // ~5x5..21x21
01548     int minDisparity;  // minimum disparity (can be negative)
01549     int numberOfDisparities; // maximum disparity - minimum disparity (> 0)
01550 
01551     // post-filtering
01552     int textureThreshold;  // the disparity is only computed for pixels
01553                            // with textured enough neighborhood
01554     int uniquenessRatio;   // accept the computed disparity d* only if
01555                            // SAD(d) >= SAD(d*)*(1 + uniquenessRatio/100.)
01556                            // for any d != d*+/-1 within the search range.
01557     int speckleWindowSize; // disparity variation window
01558     int speckleRange; // acceptable range of variation in window
01559 
01560     int trySmallerWindows; // if 1, the results may be more accurate,
01561                            // at the expense of slower processing 
01562 
01563     // temporary buffers
01564     CvMat* preFilteredImg0;
01565     CvMat* preFilteredImg1;
01566     CvMat* slidingSumBuf;
01567     CvMat* dbmin;
01568     CvMat* dbmax;
01569     CvMat* disp;
01570 }
01571 CvStereoBMState;
01572 
01573 #define CV_STEREO_BM_BASIC 0
01574 #define CV_STEREO_BM_FISH_EYE 1
01575 #define CV_STEREO_BM_NARROW 2
01576 
01577 CVAPI(CvStereoBMState*) cvCreateStereoBMState(int preset CV_DEFAULT(CV_STEREO_BM_BASIC),
01578                                               int numberOfDisparities CV_DEFAULT(0));
01579 
01580 CVAPI(void) cvReleaseStereoBMState( CvStereoBMState** state );
01581 
01582 CVAPI(void) cvFindStereoCorrespondenceBM( const CvArr* left, const CvArr* right,
01583                                           CvArr* disparity, CvStereoBMState* state );
01584 
01585 /* Kolmogorov-Zabin stereo-correspondence algorithm (a.k.a. KZ1) */
01586 #define CV_STEREO_GC_OCCLUDED  SHRT_MAX
